# Packages

```{r packages}

library(ggplot2)
library(DT)

```

# Exercise 1

## Dataset

```{r load data}

df <- read.csv('Case_Study_1.csv')
datatable(df)

```

## Scatterplot

```{r Scatter plot}

A <- df$manufacturing_cost[1]

Plot1 <- ggplot(df, aes(x=number_of_solar_panels, y=manufacturing_cost)) + geom_point()
Plot1

```

## Formula

$$
Y = AX^b
$$ \> We want a linear relationship, thus log transformation:

$$
\log(y) = \log(A) + b*\log(X)
$$

## Beta Parameters Estimation

```{r Beta Estimation}

b <- mean(log(df$manufacturing_cost/A)/log(df$number_of_solar_panels))

```

## Data Log Transformation

```{r Data Transformation}

df_log <- df

df_log$number_of_solar_panels <- log(df_log$number_of_solar_panels)
df_log$manufacturing_cost <- log(df_log$manufacturing_cost)

```

## Scatterplot Log

```{r Scatter plot Log}

A_log <- df_log$manufacturing_cost[1]

Plot2 <- ggplot(df_log, aes(x=number_of_solar_panels, y=manufacturing_cost)) + geom_point()
Plot2

```
